intro: Malcolmia contortuplicata var. ledebourii, commonly known as the spiralweed, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the Middle East and North Africa. It is characterized by its helically coiled stems and clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers. The plant has succulent leaves that help it conserve water in its harsh environment. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. Its unique spiral growth pattern makes it an interesting subject for botanical study.
